article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: Internet addiction is a very recent phenomenon but is already a cause for concern.Internet addiction is a mental condition characterized by excessive use of Internet, usually to the detriment of the user.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: Addiction is generally understood to be a mental disorder involving compulsive behaviour.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: There is a range of behaviours that can be referred to as Internet addiction.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: Other terms for Internet addiction include Internet addiction disorder (IAD) and net addiction.Internet addiction is also known by numerous other terms, such as  pathological Internet use, Internet dependency, problematic Internet use, Internet overuse and compulsive Internet use.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: Internet addiction is a term that any layman can understand.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: That is because excessive Internet usage is a common experience in daily life.Internet addiction is often characterized by people inching to form an emotional attachment with people and activities, all of them online.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: You may enjoy connecting to people more over the virtual interface instead of the real world; enjoy usually stems from an inability to establish real human contact.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: I witness whenever there is Internet ban in Kashmir, people especially teen-agers group behave like nuisance due to internet ban and repeatedly say Net kar gasi yele (When will Internet restores).

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: The symptoms of Internet addiction are:1.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: Excessive usage of the internet2.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: Depression, mood swings and irritability if one doesn’t get access to the internet3.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: Any effort to reduce Internet usage is usually unsuccessful4.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: You may experience constant problems in personal relationships, education and your job due to incessant Internet usage5.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: A tendency of lying to close ones when close ones ask you how much time you spend over the internet6.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: Using Internet to escape from real-world problemsFurther complicationsInternet addiction can gradually isolate you.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: You may develop an aversion to meeting and communicate with people in real life.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: an aversion to meeting and communicate with people in real life can impair your social skills and make you socially awkward.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: Internet addiction also create problems in relationships as Internet addiction can reduce the time you spend interacting personally.Internet addiction may also lead you to create online personas to evade low self-esteem issues.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: lead actually aggravates the problem instead of solving the problem; can result in severe anxiety and depression.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: Withdrawal symptoms might result in anxiety, depression, irritation and loneliness.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: Internet addiction can lead to complications such as dry eyes, headaches, change in sleep patterns and subsequent problems in falling asleep.

article_title: Internet Addiction Disorder
event: Back pain from sitting upright while you are on Internet is also a very common problem.

article_title: Ahead of Meeting Trump,PM Imran Khan Talks of Creating a ‘New Pakistan’
event: WASHINGTON  — Addressing Pakistan's US diaspora at a large community event in the Capital One Arena in Washington DC ahead of his much-anticipated first bilateral meeting with United States President Donald Trump, his said his is on a mission to create a “New Pakistan” for his's people.his, was accompanied by Foreign Minister Shah Mahmood Qureshi, his's Advisers on Finance and Commerce Dr. Abdul Hafeez Shaikh and Abdul Razak Dawood, and Minister of State for Overseas Pakistanis Zulfi Bukhari to a large community event in the Capital One Arena in Washington DC ahead of his much-anticipated first bilateral meeting with United States President Donald Trump on Sunday.a large community event in the Capital One Arena in Washington DC ahead of his much-anticipated first bilateral meeting with United States President Donald Trump was organised by Dr. Abdullah Riar, Secretary of the Office of International Chapters of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaaf's ruling PTI party.

article_title: Ahead of Meeting Trump,PM Imran Khan Talks of Creating a ‘New Pakistan’
event: a large community event in the Capital One Arena in Washington DC ahead of his much-anticipated first bilateral meeting with United States President Donald Trump was attended by about 20,000 people.his told about 20,000 people that, "Today what is happening in Pakistan's, is the formation of a Naya (New) Pakistan,” which would be based on a system of merit, where leaders and politicians would be made answerable for leaders and politicians's actions.Pakistan's at this time, his said, was in dire need of a system based on meritocracy, where good leaders would, with the passage of time, replace bad ones in every walk of life, be it politics or business or sports.

event: NEW DELHI — A bill proposing to give the Centre the power to set the tenure and salaries of the Chief Information Commissioner (CIC) and Information Commissioners was passed in the Lok Sabha on Monday amid strong objection from the Opposition.A bill proposing to give the Centre the power to set the tenure and salaries of the Chief Information Commissioner (CIC) and Information Commissioners was passed after the division of votes with 178 members favouring A bill proposing to give the Centre the power to set the tenure and salaries of the Chief Information Commissioner (CIC) and Information Commissioners and 79 against A bill proposing to give the Centre the power to set the tenure and salaries of the Chief Information Commissioner (CIC) and Information Commissioners.A bill proposing to give the Centre the power to set the tenure and salaries of the Chief Information Commissioner (CIC) and Information Commissioners amends Sections 13 and 16 of the Right to Information (RTI) Act, 2005.

article_title: LS Passes RTI Amendment Bill; Opposition Says 'Dark Day For Democracy

article_title: GOI Says Delimitation Within State Constitution
event: SRINAGAR — Until the area of Jammu and Kashmir under the control of Pakistan ceases to be so, 24 seats out of 111 seats in the Legislative Assembly shall remain vacant and shall not be taken into account for reckoning the total membership of the Legislative Assembly, government of India said on Tuesday.

article_title: GOI Says Delimitation Within State Constitution
event: Responding to series of questions by Bharatiya Janata Party Lok Sabha member Ajay Misra Teni, MoS Home g. Kishan Reddy said: “As per section 47 of the Constitution of Jammu and Kashmir, the Legislative Assembly consists of 111 members chosen by direct election from territorial constituencies in Jammu.” However, MoS Home g. Kishan Reddy said, as per section 47 of the Constitution of Jammu and Kashmirthe Constitution of Jammu and Kashmir, until the area of Jammu and Kashmir under the control of Pakistan Pakistan ceases to be so occupied and the people residing in the area of Jammu and Kashmir under the control of Pakistan elect the people residing in that area's representatives, 24 seats out of 111 seats in the Legislative Assembly shall remain vacant and shall not be taken into account for reckoning the total membership of the J&K’s lower house.”Regarding the process for carrying out the delimitation of Assembly segments, MoS Home g. Kishan Reddy said the process for carrying out the delimitation of Assembly segments is provided within the Constitution of Jammu and Kashmir, and not the Constitution of government of India.“Article 170 of the Constitution of India that deals with Delimitation of the constituencies for State Legislative Assemblies has not been extended to Jammu and Kashmir,” MoS Home g. Kishan Reddy said, adding, “Delimitation of Legislative Assembly Constituencies in Jammu is carried out under sections 47 and 141 of the Constitution of Jammu and Kashmir.”

article_title: 4 Amarnath Pilgrims Die; Toll Reaches 30
event: SRINAGAR —  Four Amarnath pilgrims have died over the past 24 hours en route the holy cave shrine in south Kashmir Himalayas, taking the death toll in this year's pilgrimage to 30, officials said on Wednesday.

article_title: 4 Amarnath Pilgrims Die; Toll Reaches 30
event: "While three pilgrims died on Tuesday, one more pilgrim died this morning due to various causes during Four Amarnath pilgrims's pilgrimage to the holy cave shrine in south Kashmir Himalayas," officials said.officials said the death toll in this year's pilgrimage this year's pilgrimage has now gone up to 30, which included Four Amarnath pilgrimsthe holy cave shrine in south Kashmir Himalayas.In addition to Four Amarnath pilgrims, 40 others have been taken ill or sustained injuries due to shooting stones and other causes since this year's pilgrimage began on July 1, officials said.Deaths due to cardiac arrest triggered by lack of oxygen in the area around the holy cave shrine in south Kashmir Himalayas have been common over the years, prompting the Shri Amarnath Shrine Board to issue regular health advisories to the pilgrims.All pilgrims are required to get a fitness certificate from a doctor before undertaking this year's pilgrimage.Nearly 2.96 lakh pilgrims have paid obeisance to the naturally formed ice-lingam in the holy cave shrine in south Kashmir Himalayas in the 24 days of this year's pilgrimage.The number of pilgrims who have paid obeisance at the holy cave shrine in south Kashmir Himalayas this year's is already higher than the 2.83 lakh of last year.

article_title: 4 Amarnath Pilgrims Die; Toll Reaches 30

article_title: Cong Seeks PM's Statement On Kashmir Issue, Walks Out Of LS
event: NEW DELHI — The Congress on Wednesday walked out of the Lok Sabha, demanding that Prime Minister Narendra Modi make a statement on US President Donald Trump's claim on Kashmir mediation.the Lok Sabha witnessed vociferous protests from opposition parties over the issue.

article_title: Cong Seeks PM's Statement On Kashmir Issue, Walks Out Of LS
event: "We want to hear the facts from the horse's mouth.

article_title: Cong Seeks PM's Statement On Kashmir Issue, Walks Out Of LS
event: What is wrong in demanding.

article_title: Cong Seeks PM's Statement On Kashmir Issue, Walks Out Of LS
event: "We want that Prime Minister Narendra Modi should come and give a statement," The Congress leader in the Lok Sabha Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said.As opposition parties were shouting slogans in the well, the Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla gave opposition parties time to raise the issue.However, when Defence Minister Rajnath Singh stood for the reply, The Congress staged a walkout from the Lok Sabha demanding a reply from Prime Minister Narendra Modi.Congress leader in the Lok Sabha Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said people want to know what transpired between US President Donald Trump's and Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Osaka in June.Congress leader in the Lok Sabha Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said under the Shimla agreement, Kashmir is a bilateralissue and no third party mediation is acceptable.

article_title: Cong Seeks PM's Statement On Kashmir Issue, Walks Out Of LS
event: "But we are seeing that US President Donald Trump's stated that Prime Minister Narendra Modi asked for mediation," Congress leader in the Lok Sabha Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said, adding asked could be right or wrong but neither US President Donald Trump's nor Prime Minister Narendra Modi has denied asked.

article_title: Cong Seeks PM's Statement On Kashmir Issue, Walks Out Of LS
event: "He (Modi) is giving answers through Prime Minister Narendra Modi's representatives," Congress leader in the Lok Sabha Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said.DMK leader T R Baalu said it was a strange situation that opposition parties have to demand the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi in the Lok Sabha.the Lok Sabha witnessed ruckus for the second straight day on Wednesday on the issue.Joined by members from some other Opposition parties, The Congress members trooped into the well soon after the Question Hour began and were engaged in sloganeering.More than 30 members, mainly from The Congress, were in the well shouting slogans even as Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla went ahead with the Question Hour.On Monday, US President Donald Trump's claimed that Prime Minister Narendra Modi had asked US President Donald Trump's to play the role of a mediator on Kashmir but the government said Prime Minister Narendra Modi made no request to US President Donald Trump's.Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi said that External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has already clarified on the issue and wondered what was the problem now.Later, Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi was seen having a chat with Home Minister Amit Shah.As the uproar continued, Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi said that while no doubt about the issue is left since the External Affairs Minister has already given a statement, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh would respond during Zero Hour as The Congress has again raised the issue.However, protesting members were not convinced and continued with protesting members's sloganeering.

article_title: Cong Seeks PM's Statement On Kashmir Issue, Walks Out Of LS
event: protesting members were heard shouting 'Prime Minister jawab do jawab do' (Prime Minister should answer).On Tuesday also, The Congress had sought a response from Prime Minister on the issue.

article_title: ‘Over 3,000 Rape Cases Reported In 10 Years In J&K’
event: SRINAGAR — Over 3,000 rape cases were reported in Jammu and Kashmir from 2009 to 2018, according to data compiled by the  Jammu and Kashmir police.data compiled by the  Jammu and Kashmir police reveals that on an average 300 rape incidents were witnessed each year in Jammu, with a considerable rise in such incidents between 2009 to 2013.As per a police report, a copy of which is with the Kashmir Observer, the police registered 237 rape incidents in 2009.

article_title: ‘Over 3,000 Rape Cases Reported In 10 Years In J&K’
event: The number of such incidents rose to 245 in 2010.

article_title: ‘Over 3,000 Rape Cases Reported In 10 Years In J&K’
event: 237 rape incidents jumped to 277 in 2011 while The number of such incidents further increased to 303 in 2012 and The number of such incidents rose to 378 in 2013.However, The number of such incidents saw a slight decrease to 354 in 2014 while The number of such incidents declined to 315 incidents in 2015 and to 275 in 2016.The rape cases saw an increase again in 2017 when 317 cases were registered by the police and The number of such incidents again rose to 354 in 2018.As per figures, of 3542018, 55  were registered in Jammu followed by 29 incidents in Rajouri, 27 in Udhampur, 22 in Reasi, 20 in Poonch, 16 in Ramban, 14 in Kathua, 12 in Doda, nine in Kishtiwar and seven in Samba.In Kashmir, 21 rape cases were registered in Budgam district followed by 20 rape incidents in Anantnag district, 18 in SRINAGAR, 17 in Kupwara, 15 in Kulgam, 11 in Sopore, 10 in Baramulla, seven each in Bandipora and Ganderbal, five each in Awantipora and Leh, three each in Pulwama and Shopian, while one rape case was registered by police in Handwara.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: SRINAGAR — How does one feel after spending almost more years of life in jail than outside and that too for a crime one never committed?“I am reborn today.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: We felt We will die in jail,” says Latif Ahmed Baja with a deep sense of loss.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: Latif Ahmed Baja stepped out of Jaipur jail along with two other Kashmiris—Ali Muhammad Bhatt (48) and Mirza Nisar (39— after being acquitted by the Rajasthan High Court on Monday, 23 years after We were arrested and lodged in different jails in connection with a bomb blast in a bus at Samleti in Rajasthan.the Rajasthan High Court acquitted six accused, three of six accused, three of them from Kashmir from Kashmir.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: Sentences of two other convicts were upheld by the Rajasthan High Court.Latif Ahmed Baja had been incarcerated from 8 June 1997 while two others were imprisoned from 17 June 1996, and 27 July 1996.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: During this time, We were lodged in jails in Delhi, Jaipur, and Gujarat, but were never released on parole or bail.Latif Ahmed Bajatwo other Kashmiris—Ali Muhammad Bhatt (48) and Mirza Nisar (39—Mirza Nisar (39, were detained soon after a bomb blast on a bus on the Jaipur-Agra Highway on May 22, 1996.All the three were released as the prosecution failed to prove We's involvement after being held for over 23 years in different jails.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: While acquitting We, the Rajasthan High Court said the prosecution had failed to provide evidence of the conspiracy.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: the Rajasthan High Court said the prosecution could not establish any link between We and the main accused— Dr. Abdul Hameed whose death sentence was upheld.In the first flight from Delhi on Wednesday morning, We drove to We's home with a few of We's family members.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: A large number of We's friends, relatives, and neighbors assembled to welcome We.Before We were jailed, We was dealing with carpets and other Kashmiri handicrafts with business centralized in Delhi and Kathmandu.Latif Ahmed Baja says Latif Ahmed Baja was offering Asar prayers when around a dozen of cops raided We's rented apartment in Kathmandu.“We didn't know what was going on.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: around a dozen of cops bundled We in a vehicle and drove We towards Delhi,” Latif Ahmed Baja said.Latif Ahmed Baja says We were detained for a week in a local police station and were produced in Delhi court for remand.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: After that, Latif Ahmed Baja says, We were sent to Delhi's Tihar jail.Latif Ahmed Baja was then taken to Jaipur jail alone from then Latif Ahmed Baja was taken to Gujarat jail where Latif Ahmed Baja was detained for a period two years.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: After that, Latif Ahmed Baja was taken back to New Delhi’s Tihar jail.Latif Ahmed Baja couldn’t still find what was going on and why We were being punished for the crime We never committed.Latif Ahmed Baja was linked with a blast that had occurred in Mahua in 1996 and then also with the Lajpat Nagar bomb blast case of May 1996 and the same challan was produced in every case,” Latif Ahmed Baja said.As Latif Ahmed Baja was narrating the story, a large number of relatives and friends gathered around Latif Ahmed Baja to hear the story.Recounting Latif Ahmed Baja's time in jail, Latif Ahmed Baja says Latif Ahmed Baja Mirza Nisar (39 would exercise and pray regularly and would ask for the release from God.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: “We lost hopes of seeing the outside world but at the end God is Great,” Latif Ahmed Baja says.We were beaten ruthlessly by the other jail inmates along with the security guards after the Pulwama attack", Latif Ahmed Baja recalled.“If We are alive and free today are’s because of human rights groups of Jaipur and members of Jamaat-e-Islami Hind.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: human rights groups of Jaipur and members of Jamaat-e-Islami Hind played a crucial role in We's acquittal and mounted pressure on the jail authorities after We were attacked,” Latif Ahmed Baja claims.According to Latif Ahmed Baja, the jail superintended Mohan Chand Rakesh Sharma was so  “ruthless”  that even after our acquittal, the jail superintended Mohan Chand Rakesh Sharma wasn't happy to let We go and told We how were We acquitted.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: Latif Ahmed Baja says as Latif Ahmed Baja sat on a chair in a hall packed with the visitors.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: Latif Ahmed Baja is unable to sit on the floor because the torture  of years have made Latif Ahmed Baja's legs week.We couldn't believe the news of our acquittal for over three days.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: “We couldn't sleep with happiness,” Latif Ahmed Baja said and continued: “Latif Ahmed Baja banged Latif Ahmed Baja's head with the wall in order to feel that Latif Ahmed Baja am not dreaming.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: You can see a minor injury on my head", Latif Ahmed Baja said.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: When Latif Ahmed Baja heard that We will see the dawn of freedom from the jail, We hugged and wept profusely,” Latif Ahmed Baja said.Having lost Latif Ahmed Baja's precious years of life in jail, Latif Ahmed Baja said Latif Ahmed Baja has nothing to say and now Latif Ahmed Baja wants to spend the rest of life with Latif Ahmed Baja's family.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: Latif Ahmed Baja spent 13 years in New Delhi’s Tihar jail, 9 in Jaipur and 2 years in Gujarat Jail.At the residence of Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal, a huge crowd of people was jostling to meet Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal.As Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal stepped inside the residence of Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal, Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal's family members sacrificed a sheep.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: Emotions ran high with family and friends kissing and hugging Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal.Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal am unable to recognize Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal's relatives and friends.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: Only a few people who came to meet Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal in Jail are known,” Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal said.Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal said Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal was just 16 years of age when Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal was made an accused, but the officials showed Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal's age as 19 then.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: Now Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal is 39.“How can Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal explain Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal's 23 years of life in jail within few minutes,” Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal says.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: “We were literally in hell and We cannot believe We are free now,” Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal said.Echoing the Latif Ahmed Baja claim Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal also says the jail inmates hate the Muslims so much that the jail inmates don’t want to see the Muslims anywhere.“And when you are a Kashmiri and that too a Muslim, one can imagine the height of hatred,” Mirza Nisar Hussain son of Mirza Ali Muhammad, a resident of Namchabal, Fateh Kadal said.Muhammad Ali Bhat son of Sher Ali Bhat, a resident of Hassanabad, SRINAGAR, lost Muhammad Ali Bhat son of Sher Ali Bhat, a resident of Hassanabad, Srinagar's parents while Muhammad Ali Bhat son of Sher Ali Bhat, a resident of Hassanabad, Srinagar was in jail.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: Muhammad Ali Bhat son of Sher Ali Bhat, a resident of Hassanabad, Srinagar's other brother Iftikhar Ali Mirza was also in New Delhi’s Tihar jail and was released after 14-years, in the year 2010.“I was arrested in 1996 and was lodged in New Delhi’s Tihar jail till 2014 and then shifted to Jaipur Jail where His other brother Iftikhar Ali Mirza was lodged till last week,” Muhammad Ali Bhat son of Sher Ali Bhat, a resident of Hassanabad, Srinagar says.“It’s better to die than spend life in jails but God gave We strength and We were hopeful that We will be out of bars one day.Muhammad Ali Bhat son of Sher Ali Bhat, a resident of Hassanabad, Srinagar said that Muhammad Ali Bhat son of Sher Ali Bhat, a resident of Hassanabad, Srinagar had thought that Muhammad Ali Bhat son of Sher Ali Bhat, a resident of Hassanabad, Srinagar would meet Muhammad Ali Bhat son of Sher Ali Bhat, a resident of Hassanabad, Srinagar's family after Muhammad Ali Bhat son of Sher Ali Bhat, a resident of Hassanabad, Srinagar's release but “all have died, Muhammad Ali Bhat son of Sher Ali Bhat, a resident of Hassanabad, Srinagar's father, mother, and sister are no more,” Muhammad Ali Bhat son of Sher Ali Bhat, a resident of Hassanabad, Srinagar said with moist eyes.

article_title: Feel Like Reborn: 3 Wrongfully Jailed Kashmiris Walk Free After 23 Years
event: “Muhammad Ali Bhat son of Sher Ali Bhat, a resident of Hassanabad, Srinagar am happy but not seeing his family around Muhammad Ali Bhat son of Sher Ali Bhat, a resident of Hassanabad, Srinagar feel sad.”

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Few places so mesmerising carry the pain of Kashmir.The Himalayan region, contested for seven decades by Indiaand Pakistan, has been a hideout for Islamabad-backed militants; witnessed the forced expulsion of a Hindu community as authorities did nothing; and seen a Muslim-majority area become home to 500,000 Indian troops reportedly responsible for widespread abuses.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: The Himalayan region, contested for seven decades by Indiaand Pakistan is place burdened both by history and the desire for something better.Into this mix now steps Donald Trump.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Meeting this week in the Oval Office with Pakistan prime minister Imran Khan, Donald Trump offered to act as a mediator between the two neighbours.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Donald Trump claimed was asked to perform such as role by India’s Narendra Modi.Donald Trump was with India’s Narendra Modi two weeks ago and India’s Narendra Modi actually said, ‘Would Donald Trump like to be a mediator, or an arbitrator?’ And Donald Trump said, 'Where?'

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: And India’s Narendra Modi said ‘Kashmir’,” said Donald Trump.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: “If Donald Trump can help, Donald Trump would love to be a mediator.”For those with any knowledge of India’s or Pakistan, it was a moment when jaws dropped.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Why would India’sthe two neighbours, have asked Donald Trump to become involved?

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Within an hour, Delhi made clear Delhi had not requested Washington’s assistance after all.Immediately, scorn was heaped on Donald Trump.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: What did Donald Trump know about Kashmir, other than the fitted sweaters worn by the First Lady?

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Why would Donald Trump risk antagonising a democratic Asian giant the US wants as a counterweight to China?

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: And what in heaven’s name could Donald Trump actually do about Kashmir anyway?There’s another way to view this, and another way to view this starts with a record of failure.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: For 70 years, the two neighbours have mutually obsessed over The Himalayan region, contested for seven decades by Indiaand PakistanThe Himalayan region, contested for seven decades by Indiaand Pakistan's .

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Three times the two neighbours have gone to war.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: At the same time, the two neighbours have largely ignored the concerns of the people of Kashmir.On the Pakistan side, Islamabad has dismissed the requests of Azad Kashmir and Gilgit-Baltistan, which want to become full provinces and secure more rights.On India’s's part, in the late 1980s Delhi did nothing as countless thousands of Hindu Pandits were forced from the Kashmir Valley while an insurgency against Delhi by the Muslim community, furious over a fixed election, gathered force.Since then, half a million troops and paramilitaries have set up razor wire and bunkers across towns such as Srinagar, frequently killing stone-throwing youths.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: The military is protected by a shameful piece of legislation, the Armed Forces Special Powers Act (AFSPA), which effectively gives The military a free hand.Attendant to protected, Delhi Islamabad have used Kashmir as a strategic pawn — Pakistan in Pakistan's appeals to the UN about alleged Indian human rights abuses; and India’s by choosing to ignore local demands for greater autonomy by writing local demands for greater autonomy off as Pakistan-produced propaganda.It’s not a great record.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Up to 75,000 soldiers, civilians and police officers have lost Up to 75,000 soldiers, civilians and police officers's lives, in attacks, explosions or cross-border bombing.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: All this in a land of houseboats and poetry, that until the mid-1980s was a tourist’s dream, as well as the location for numerous Bollywood movies.It is not as though large numbers in the two neighbours do not want peace.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: In 2001, Pakistan's Pervez Musharraf and India’s's Atal Bihari Vajpayee almost brokered a deal that would have seen demilitarisation in Kashmir, free movement, and the recognition of what is currently termed the Line of Control as the recognised border.As it was, a deal that would have seen demilitarisation in Kashmir, free movement, and the recognition of what is currently termed the Line of Control as the recognised border with not seized, and the two neighbours fell back into an angry standoff, with hundreds of thousands of troops amassed at the border.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: For several months in late 2001 and early 2002, foreign diplomats based in the two neighbours believed the two neighbours were about to engage in a catastrophic war.the two neighbours currently have a better chance at brokering a deal than ever before.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Pakistan prime minister Imran Khan has the support of Pakistan's powerful military, which would have to sign off on a deal.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Modi occupies an equally strong position, being as Modi is a Hindu nationalist leader who just won re-election by a landslide.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Because of occupies, any peace effort would have a better chance of not being undermined by hardliners, as happened to earlier efforts involving Rajiv Gandhi and Benazir Bhutto.It helps, too, that Khan, the former cricketer, is hugely admired by Pakistan's neighbours.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Khan, the former cricketer once said: “Khan, the former cricketer, for one, have received so much love in India’s.”The US’s role would be to act as guarantor of a deal that would have seen demilitarisation in Kashmir, free movement, and the recognition of what is currently termed the Line of Control as the recognised border.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: It would demand Pakistan put an end to cross-border incursions, and call on the two neighbours to demilitarise.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: It would treat the two neighbours as equal partners in a deal that would have seen demilitarisation in Kashmir, free movement, and the recognition of what is currently termed the Line of Control as the recognised border, and display transparency.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Such a deal would provide stability not just to Kashmir, but to the broader region, including Pakistan.Does Donald Trump know anything about Kashmir?

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Of course not.But whether Donald Trump's critics like to admit it or not — and putting aside Donald Trump's motivations — Donald Trump is a disruptor, a frequently clumsy clown who bashes into things.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Whether Donald Trump's outreach with Pyongyang leads to something lasting is still unclear.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: But the scenes of Donald Trump crossing into North Korea with Kim Jong-un were genuinely remarkable.the two neighbours, secured the two neighbours's independence amid the bloody and murderous experience of Partition.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Neither, rightly, likes to be lectured by the West.Yet Donald Trump, in what many dismissed as another sign of Donald Trump's ignorance, made a rather telling point when Donald Trump spoke on Monday.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: “This has been going on for many, many years,” Donald Trump said.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: “Donald Trump was surprised for how long This has been going on.”For too long, the two neighbours have sat on the two neighbours's hands over Kashmir.

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Why not try something different?

article_title: Time to Roll the Dice
event: Sometimes, crazy situations require a crazy-sounding solution.Source: Independent

article_title: Bill to Designate Individual as Terrorist Passed in LS
event: NEW DELHI — The Lok Sabha on Wednesday approved a bill to amend UAPA aimed at allowing the government to designate an individual as a militant with Home Minister Amit Shah asserting this is of "prime importance" to nip militancy in the bud.Stoutly defending the amendments to UAPA to make UAPA "strict", Home Minister Amit Shah also allayed fears of the opposition parties on UAPA's misuse, saying UAPA will keep the investigation agencies "four steps" ahead of the terrorists.Replying to a debate on a bill to amend UAPA aimed at allowing the government to designate an individual as a militant before a bill to amend UAPA aimed at allowing the government to designate an individual as a militant was passed by voice vote, Home Minister Amit Shah said though UAPA will not be misused against any individual, yet, those who engage in terrorist activities against the security and sovereignty of the government, including the 'urban maoists', would not be spared by the investigation agencies either.Reiterating the zero tolerance policy of the Modi government against terrorism, Home Minister Amit Shah said the objective of the amendments to the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act(UAPA) is to facilitate speedy investigation and prosecution of terror offences and designating an individual as terrorist in line with the international practices.An individual's psychology is the birth place of terrorism, rather than an institution.

article_title: Bill to Designate Individual as Terrorist Passed in LS
event: If, in the first place, an individual is stopped from attracting other individuals into terrorism by providing ideological and financial support, terrorism can be finished,"he said.Hence, designating an individual as terrorist, after following the due process of law, is of "prime importance" to nip terrorism in the bud.The anti-terror law, so far, only had provisions to ban groups as individual groups, not individuals.a bill to amend UAPA aimed at allowing the government to designate an individual as a militant additionally empowers the officers of the NIA, of the rank of Inspector or above, to investigate cases.

article_title: LS Pronounces Upto 3-years Jail for Instant Triple Talaq
event: NEW DELHI — Lok Sabha on Thursday passes the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq.

article_title: LS Pronounces Upto 3-years Jail for Instant Triple Talaq
event: Several amendments moved by the Opposition were defeated.The clause in the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq which criminalises the practice of instant triple talaq with a jail term of upto three years for the husband was passed by a division of 302 in favour and 78 against.the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq will now be tabled in Rajya Sabha, where the Opposition is numerically higher than the ruling side.Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said that the practice of instant triple talaq is practiced only in one community, therefore, a law banning the practice of instant triple talaq cannot be applied for any other community.Earlier during Thursday, Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad defended the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq, saying  the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq was a must for gender equality and justice and despite the Supreme Court striking down the practice of instant triple talaq as illegal and unconstitutional, several hundred cases have been reported.Replying to the debate on the Muslim Women (Protection of Rights on Marriage) Bill, 2019 in Lok Sabha, Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad questioned the Opposition to up to three-year jail term for the husband who gives the practice of instant triple talaq.

article_title: LS Pronounces Upto 3-years Jail for Instant Triple Talaq
event: "When Hindus and Muslims are jailed under dowry law or Domestic Violence Act, no one objects.

article_title: LS Pronounces Upto 3-years Jail for Instant Triple Talaq
event: What is the objection in penalising the practice of instant triple talaq," Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said.Several opposition parties bitterly opposed the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq, but the government asserted that the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq is a step towards gender equality and justice.

article_title: LS Pronounces Upto 3-years Jail for Instant Triple Talaq
event: Parties like the Congress, the Trinamool Congress and the DMK demanded that the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq be sent to a parliamentary committee for scrutiny.

article_title: LS Pronounces Upto 3-years Jail for Instant Triple Talaq
event: Some of the BJP's allies, including the JD(U), also expressed Some of the BJP's allies, including the JD(U)'s reservation about the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq.Under the Muslim Women (Protection of Rights on Marriage) Bill, 2019, divorcing through the practice of instant triple talaq will be illegal, void and would attract a jail term of three years for the husband.Earlier, Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said to allay fears that the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq could be misused, the government has included certain safeguards in the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq such as adding a provision of bail for the accused before trial.While the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq makes the practice of instant triple talaq a "non-bailable" offence, an accused can approach a magistrate even before trial to seek bail.In a non-bailable offence, bail cannot be granted by police at the police station the police station itself.A provision has been added to allow the magistrate to grant bail "after hearing the wife", Law Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said.the contentious Triple Talaq Bill, banning the practice of instant triple talaq was passed by the Lok Sabha in December last year but lapsed in Rajya Sabha, where the opposition is numerically higher than the ruling side after the dissolution of the Lower House.

article_title: LS Pronounces Upto 3-years Jail for Instant Triple Talaq
event: The current bill seeks to replace an ordinance for the practice of instant triple talaq which was issued by the cabinet last February.

article_title: Dispatch from Tral: The Ordeal of Tral Sub District Hospital
event: TRAL — Catering to 105 villages, the sub district hospital in TRAL, which was upgraded from Community Health Centre three decades back in 1988, lacks doctors, staff, primary health centers and high tech machineries due to which patients continue to suffer here with no intervention from higher authorities.As compared to SDH Pampore, SDH Bijbehara, SDH Sopore and other hospitals, the sub district hospital in Tral, which was upgraded from Community Health Centre three decades back in 1988, as per records, lacks adequate staff, doctors, health centres and high tech machineries as “all other SDHs were upgraded with all the facilities unlike Sub district hospital Tral, which is considered as one of the oldest hospitals in Kashmir valley and hasn’t been upgraded yet with such facilities even after the passing of three decades, due to which patients face inconveniences here.the sub district hospital in Tral, which was upgraded from Community Health Centre three decades back in 1988 despite being under the tag of “Sub district hospital” lacks Ophthalmologist, Orthopaedic, ENT, permanent Radiologist and other staff, as the sub district hospital in Tral, which was upgraded from Community Health Centre three decades back in 1988 was upgraded only on papers with no creation of posts till the date .Where as in Sub District Hospital Pampore and Community Health Centre Rajpora, all the posts were created and were made functional.As per the official record, at present, the sub district hospital in Tral, which was upgraded from Community Health Centre three decades back in 1988 has deficiency of 93 manpower, and as per the guidelines of Indian public health standard all these posts need to be created and fulfilled.While comparing health sector of district Pulwama, TRAL being 2nd in number as per population and has 5 to 7 PHCs less as compared to Pampore and district Pulwama, with result 119 manpower is less than these two blocks including 30 doctors.Despite lacking all this, the Radiologist as per hospital sources is officially posted at TRAL but “the Radiologist only gives three days duty at the sub district hospital in Tral, which was upgraded from Community Health Centre three decades back in 1988 and four others days at district Pulwama” which is also the matter of grave concern.The sources in the sub district hospital in Tral, which was upgraded from Community Health Centre three decades back in 1988 also revealed that a digital x-ray machine was also given to the sub district hospital in Tral, which was upgraded from Community Health Centre three decades back in 1988 but “after functioning for some months a digital x-ray machine got damaged and is yet to repaired for public conveniences, which is the matter of grave concern”Moreover, despite growing dog bite cases in TRAL, the sub district hospital in Tral, which was upgraded from Community Health Centre three decades back in 1988 is short of anti-rabies vaccine due to which patients involved in dog bite cases suffer as patients involved in dog bite cases either go Srinagar or district Pulwama to get anti-rabies vaccine there in order to treat dog bite cases.It is pertinent to mention here that around 500 people have been bitten by stray dogs in last two years at TRAL, as per the records available at hospital.Keeping in view, all these things, authorities should ensure the official up-gradation of the sub district hospital in Tral, which was upgraded from Community Health Centre three decades back in 1988 to make the sub district hospital in Tral, which was upgraded from Community Health Centre three decades back in 1988 equal to other SDHs.To conclude, I can say that, health care facilities in TRAL should be upgraded to mitigate the problems of the inhabitants of more than 105 villages, who could be seen suffering always in and around the main hospital and other health centres in TRAL.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: SRINAGAR — Jammu and Kashmir will be part of a joint working group announced on Thursday  by the chief ministers of northern states to share experiences and best practices to tackle the menace of drug abuse.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: In a joint statement, the chief ministers of Punjab, Rajasthan, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand, as well as top officials from Delhi, Jammu and Kashmir, and Chandigarh, agreed on a series of powerful measures to eradicate the drugs problem in the region, Press Trust of India reported.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: The event was also attended by officials of the Intelligence Bureau, Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) and other central agencies.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: a series of powerful measures to eradicate the drugs problem in the region included joint operations at the interstate borders, information sharing and implementation of the best practices of the participating states, a joint statement said.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: There was consensus among the participating states on the importance of strengthening the information-sharing mechanism on drugs, drug dealers and smugglers for an effective crackdown.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: the participating states agreed to launch major awareness programmes to make the eradication of drugs a peoples' movement, a joint statement said.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: The event proposed to jointly press the Centre to come out with a national drugs policy in order to effectively tackle the menace of drug abuse.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: the participating states also agreed to urge the Centre to establish a regional drug dependence treatment centre in Chandigarh on the lines of the National Drug Dependence Treatment Centre (NDDTC), AIIMS, New Delhi.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: the participating states agreed to consider opening a regional training centre in Chandigarh for training of investigators for proper investigation of the cases under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: "We believe that these efforts will go a long way in eradicating the menace of drug abuse from the region, thus protecting our youth and our future generations, and ensuring a safe, secure and healthy society," according to a joint statement.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: the participating states said the participating states were committed to strengthen the process of consultation and cooperation, and collaborate more closely for making the region 'nasha mukt' (drug free).

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: Speaking during The event, J&K Governor’s Advisor KK Sharma said the policy introduced by J&K was  the second document in India after Punjab drafted for de-addiction.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: “the policy introduced by the State in comparison to other policies has thrust on demand deduction rather than harm deduction,” an official spokesperson quoted J&K Governor’s Advisor KK Sharma as saying.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: “J&K Governor’s Advisor KK Sharma would like to bring forth the fact that following implementation there is a massive multi-pronged strategy from various stake holders to limit the problem of drug addiction to minimal.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: From awareness campaigns to war on availability to treatment of affected all areas are being addressed in a sustained and goal directed way,” J&K Governor’s Advisor KK Sharma added.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: J&K Governor’s Advisor KK Sharma said that it would also be helpful to exchange the best practices of States in countering drug menace.

article_title: J&K Joins Joint Working Group Of States Against Drug Menace
event: Similarly, the experiment of J&K Police drug de-addiction centers to cater to borderline cases is an example, J&K Governor’s Advisor KK Sharma added.

article_title: Good alone Triumphs evil
event: ‘Truth has arrived and falsehood has perished, indeed is falsehood bound to perish’ (Al Quran) Ever since the existence of humankind on the planet there has always been a war wagging between; Good and Evil, Truth and Falsehood, Justice and Oppression.

article_title: Good alone Triumphs evil
event: History stands witness to the times when falsehood and oppression were all time high and had torn apart the basic human values and ethos and pushed the world into the abyss of gloom and doom.

article_title: Good alone Triumphs evil
event: But every time amidst escalated falsehood and tyranny, a blazing torch of light and truth in the shape of a prophet, a messenger or a messiah, or an ordinary human being rose up who fought firmly and bravely against the evil prevalent and in the end prevailed over all the falsehood, all the oppression and all the evil, which can be again seen from the pages of history.

article_title: Beware of the New Danger!
event: Do people really understand climate change and global warming?

article_title: Beware of the New Danger!
event: A few days of unseasonal chill brings back the sceptic in everyone – if the earth is getting hotter then why are we experiencing low temperatures, is a common question.That the earth is getting hotter is no longer a moot question.

article_title: Beware of the New Danger!
event: It is.

article_title: Beware of the New Danger!
event: But will the heat kill you?

article_title: Beware of the New Danger!
event: Yes.

article_title: US To Resume Death Penalty After 16-Year Break
event: WASHINGTON —  The US government will resume The US government's use of capital punishment after a 16-year hiatus and has set execution dates for five convicted murderers, Attorney General Bill Barr announced on Thursday.Acting on President Donald Trump’s call for tougher penalties on violent crimes, Attorney General Bill Barr directed the Federal Bureau of Prisons to adopt a new lethal injection protocol to clear the way to carry out death sentences.“The Justice Department upholds the rule of law — and “The Justice Department owe it to the victims and the victims's families to carry forward the sentence imposed by The US government's justice system,” Attorney General Bill Barr said in a statement.There were 25 executions in The US government last year, all carried out by state authorities on people convicted on state charges.But debate about the methods of execution and controversy over the drugs used, as well as reticence from President Donald Trump’s's predecessor Barack Obama, means that no federal prisoner has been put to death since Attorney General Bill Barr ordered the Federal Bureau of Prisons to carry out executions using a single lethal injection of the barbiturate pentobarbital, replacing the previous, three-drug cocktails using thiopental.“Since 2010, 14 states have used the barbiturate pentobarbital in over 200 executions, and federal courts, including the Supreme Court, have repeatedly upheld the use of pentobarbital in executions as consistent with the Eighth Amendment” of the constitution, which bars cruel and unusual punishment, “The Justice Department said.There are 62 federal death row prisoners in The US government, according to the Death Penalty Information Center, including Islamist Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, who was convicted of the 2013 Boston Marathon bombing that left three people dead.62 federal death row prisoners in the US also includes white supremacist Dylann Roof, who murdered nine African Americans in a Charleston, South Carolina church in 2015.On Attorney General Bill Barr's order, the Federal Bureau of Prisons has scheduled executions for five convicted murderers.Executions in The US government are nearly all carried out by states.

article_title: US To Resume Death Penalty After 16-Year Break
event: Twenty-five of the 50 US states maintain an active death penalty, while 21 do not allow an active death penalty and four have suspended an active death penalty's use.Federal executions were on hold for nearly four decades until 2001, when Oklahoma City bomber Timothy McVeigh was executed.

article_title: US To Resume Death Penalty After 16-Year Break
event: Two more people were put to death in federal prisons over the subsequent two years, and then Federal executions were halted again.Obama, president from 2009 to 2017, was not fundamentally opposed to an active death penalty but questioned an active death penalty's application.“The Justice Department has pressed to toughen “The Justice Department's stance on death penalty cases since President Donald Trump’s came to office, but Attorney General Bill Barr move also comes as President Donald Trump’s seeks to bolster President Donald Trump’s's law-and-order credentials ahead of next year’s election.Democratic Senator Kamala Harris, who is running for president, condemned Barr’s move.

article_title: US To Resume Death Penalty After 16-Year Break
event: “Let Democratic Senator Kamala Harris, who is running for president be clear: capital punishment is immoral and deeply flawed.

article_title: US To Resume Death Penalty After 16-Year Break
event: Too many innocent people have been put to death,” Democratic Senator Kamala Harris, who is running for president tweeted.

article_title: US To Resume Death Penalty After 16-Year Break
event: “We need a national moratorium on an active death penalty, not a resurrection.”
